canonical_explanation.text: Safety means protecting ourselves from harm and danger. Road safety rules help us stay safe when walking or travelling. We must always follow traffic signals - red means stop, yellow means wait, and green means go. We should walk on the footpath, use zebra crossings, and look both ways before crossing the road. Fire safety means being careful with fire and knowing what to do if there is a fire. We should never play with matchsticks or the gas stove. First aid is the immediate help given to a person who is hurt before a doctor arrives. For small cuts, we should wash with clean water and apply a bandage. For burns, we should hold the burn under cold running water. Personal safety means knowing about good touch and bad touch, and telling a trusted adult if someone makes us uncomfortable.
rules: Road safety: walk on footpath, use zebra crossing, follow traffic signals
Traffic lights: red = stop, yellow = wait, green = go
Always wear a seatbelt in a car and a helmet on a bicycle or scooter
Fire safety: never play with matchsticks, candles, or the gas stove
In case of fire: shout for help, call fire brigade, crawl low to avoid smoke
First aid for cuts: wash with clean water, apply antiseptic, put a bandage
First aid for burns: hold the burn under cold running water
Personal safety: know about good touch and bad touch, say NO, tell a trusted adult

questions.question_text: What does a red traffic light mean?
questions.explanation_correct: A red traffic light means STOP. When the light is red, all vehicles must stop behind the white line. Pedestrians should also wait and not cross the road. Red always means danger or stop.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Red does not mean go, slow down, or turn. Red always means STOP. You must stop and wait until the light changes to green before moving. Following traffic signals keeps everyone safe on the road.

questions.question_text: What does a green traffic light mean?
questions.explanation_correct: A green traffic light means GO, but you should still look carefully before moving. Even when the light is green, you must check if the road is clear. Green means it is your turn to move safely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Green does not mean stop, wait, or go back. Green means GO. Vehicles can start moving and pedestrians can cross, but everyone should still be careful and look around before proceeding.

questions.question_text: What does a yellow traffic light mean?

options.text: Wait and get ready (the light is about to change)

questions.explanation_correct: A yellow traffic light means WAIT. It is a warning that the light is about to change. If you are driving, slow down and get ready to stop. If you are waiting, get ready because the light will turn green soon.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Yellow does not mean speed up, turn, or park. Yellow means WAIT and be alert. It appears between red and green signals to warn that a change is coming. You should slow down and prepare to stop or go.

questions.question_text: Where should pedestrians walk on the road?

options.text: In the middle of the road

questions.explanation_correct: Pedestrians should walk on the footpath (also called pavement or sidewalk). The footpath is the safe area on the side of the road meant for people walking. If there is no footpath, walk on the far left side of the road, facing the traffic coming towards you.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Walking in the middle of the road, behind cars, or on dividers is very dangerous. The footpath is the designated safe area for pedestrians. It is separated from the road where vehicles move, keeping walkers safe.

questions.question_text: The black and white stripes on the road where people cross are called _____.
questions.explanation_correct: The black and white stripes on the road are called a zebra crossing. It is named after the zebra animal because of its similar stripe pattern. Pedestrians should use the zebra crossing to cross the road safely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The crossing is named after a zebra because of the black and white stripe pattern, just like on a zebra's body. It is called a zebra crossing, and it is the safest place for pedestrians to cross the road.

questions.question_text: Before crossing the road, Sita should _____.

options.text: Look left, then right, then left again, and cross when the road is clear
Wait for someone to carry her across

questions.explanation_correct: Before crossing the road, Sita should look left, then right, then left again to make sure no vehicles are coming. She should cross only when the road is clear and walk quickly but not run. This is the safest way to cross.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Closing eyes, not looking, or running across are all dangerous. The correct way to cross is: stop at the edge, look left, then right, then left again, and cross only when no vehicles are coming. Use a zebra crossing if available.

questions.question_text: Rahul rides his bicycle to school. What safety gear should he always wear?
questions.explanation_correct: Rahul should always wear a helmet while riding his bicycle. A helmet protects the head from injury if there is an accident or fall. Head injuries can be very serious, and a helmet can save your life.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cap, sunglasses, and scarf do not protect the head during an accident. A helmet is the most important safety gear for cycling. It is hard and padded to protect the head from injuries in case of a fall or collision.

questions.question_text: While travelling in a car, what should you always do?

options.text: Stick your hand out of the window
Open the door while the car is moving

questions.explanation_correct: You should always wear your seatbelt while travelling in a car. A seatbelt keeps you securely in your seat and protects you from being thrown forward if the car stops suddenly or is in an accident.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sticking hands out, standing on seats, and opening doors while moving are all extremely dangerous. The seatbelt is a life-saving device. It keeps you safe in your seat and must be worn at all times while the car is moving.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a road safety rule?

options.text: Always cross at the zebra crossing and follow traffic signals
Run across the road without looking
Walk in the middle of the road at night

questions.explanation_correct: Always crossing at the zebra crossing and following traffic signals are important road safety rules. These rules are designed to keep both pedestrians and drivers safe. Traffic rules save lives.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Playing on roads, running without looking, and walking in the middle of the road are all dangerous activities that can lead to accidents. The correct road safety rule is to use zebra crossings and follow traffic signals.

questions.question_text: Why should children NOT play near the road?

options.text: Because fast-moving vehicles can hit them and cause serious injuries
Because there are no toys on the road

questions.explanation_correct: Children should not play near roads because fast-moving vehicles like cars, buses, and trucks can hit them. Road accidents can cause very serious injuries or even death. Always play in parks, playgrounds, or inside the house.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The main reason is the danger of being hit by vehicles. Roads are for vehicles, not for playing. A ball rolling onto the road or a child running after it could lead to a terrible accident. Always play in safe, designated areas.

questions.question_text: Which of these should you NEVER play with?
questions.explanation_correct: You should never play with matchsticks and candles. They can easily start a fire that can burn you, your clothes, or even your whole house. Fire is very dangerous and children should stay away from things that can start a fire.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Balls, building blocks, and board games are safe toys. But matchsticks and candles are NOT toys. They produce fire, which can cause burns and start fires in the house. Children should never touch or play with fire-related items.

questions.question_text: What should you do if you see a fire in your house?

options.text: Try to put it out by yourself
Shout for help and leave the house quickly

questions.explanation_correct: If you see a fire in your house, you should shout for help so everyone knows about it and leave the house quickly. Go to a safe place and tell an adult to call the fire brigade (phone number 101). Your life is more important than anything in the house.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Hiding under the bed is dangerous because fire and smoke can reach you there. Trying to put out a big fire alone is dangerous for a child. Ignoring fire is very risky. The safest action is to alert everyone, leave immediately, and call for help.

questions.question_text: If there is smoke during a fire, how should you move to safety?

options.text: Crawl low on the floor because smoke rises up

questions.explanation_correct: During a fire, smoke rises upward. There is cleaner air near the floor. So you should crawl low on the floor to avoid breathing in the smoke. Smoke is very dangerous and can make you unconscious if you breathe too much of it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Standing tall puts your face right in the smoke. Jumping from windows and hiding are dangerous. Since smoke rises up, the cleanest air is near the floor. Crawling low helps you breathe and see your way to safety.

questions.question_text: Arun noticed that the gas stove was left on in the kitchen without any cooking. What should he do?

options.text: Immediately tell an adult to turn it off
Switch on the fan near the stove

questions.explanation_correct: Arun should immediately tell an adult to turn off the gas stove. A gas leak is very dangerous because the gas can catch fire easily. Children should never try to handle the gas stove themselves but should always get an adult's help.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Lighting a matchstick near a gas leak could cause an explosion. Ignoring it could lead to a fire or gas poisoning. Switching on electrical appliances near a gas leak is also dangerous. The safest action is to tell an adult immediately.

questions.question_text: What is the phone number to call the fire brigade in India?
questions.explanation_correct: The phone number for the fire brigade in India is 101. In case of a fire emergency, you should call 101. It is important to remember this number. 100 is for police, 102 is for ambulance, and 108 is for emergency medical services.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 100 is the police number, 102 is for ambulance, and 108 is for emergency services. The fire brigade number in India is 101. Every child should remember these important emergency numbers.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a fire safety rule?

options.text: Play with matchsticks when parents are not home
Never play with matchsticks, lighters, or the gas stove
Light candles in your room without an adult

questions.explanation_correct: Never play with matchsticks, lighters, or the gas stove. This is a very important fire safety rule. These items can start fires that spread quickly and cause serious burns or even destroy the whole house.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Playing with matchsticks, keeping firecrackers inside, and lighting candles alone are all very dangerous and can start fires. The correct fire safety rule is to never touch or play with fire-related items without adult supervision.

questions.question_text: What is first aid?

options.text: The first prize in a competition
The immediate help given to an injured person before a doctor arrives

questions.explanation_correct: First aid is the immediate help given to an injured or sick person before a doctor or medical professional arrives. Simple first aid can stop bleeding, reduce pain, and prevent the injury from getting worse.
questions.explanation_incorrect: First aid is not a prize, a school event, or a medicine. It is the quick, initial help given to someone who is hurt or ill. For example, cleaning a cut and putting a bandage on it is first aid.

questions.question_text: If you get a small cut on your finger, what should you do first?

options.text: Put tape over it without cleaning

questions.explanation_correct: If you get a small cut, the first thing to do is wash it with clean water. This removes dirt and germs from the wound. After washing, apply antiseptic cream and cover it with a clean bandage to protect it from germs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Putting mud on a cut will make it worse by adding germs. Ignoring it can lead to infection. Putting tape without cleaning traps dirt inside. The correct first step is to wash the cut with clean water to remove dirt and germs.

questions.question_text: What should you do if you get a burn from touching something hot?

options.text: Put butter or toothpaste on it
Hold the burn under cold running water for several minutes
Cover it with a thick cloth immediately

questions.explanation_correct: If you get a burn, hold the burnt area under cold running water for at least 10 minutes. The cold water cools the burn, reduces pain, and prevents the burn from going deeper. Do not apply butter, toothpaste, or ice on a burn.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Butter and toothpaste can make burns worse and trap heat. Popping blisters increases the risk of infection. The correct first aid for burns is to hold the area under cold running water for several minutes. Then tell an adult.

questions.question_text: Kavita was stung by a bee while playing in the garden. What should she do?

options.text: Wash the area with water and tell an adult who can apply a soothing cream

questions.explanation_correct: If stung by a bee, Kavita should wash the area with clean water and tell an adult. The adult can remove the stinger if it is still in the skin, apply a soothing cream, and use a cold compress to reduce swelling. If she feels dizzy or has trouble breathing, go to a doctor immediately.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Squeezing the area can push the venom deeper. Mud adds germs. Ignoring it can lead to problems. The right approach is to wash the area, tell an adult, and get proper treatment. An ice pack can help with swelling.

questions.question_text: Ajay fell while running and scraped his knee. It is bleeding a little. What should he do?

options.text: Keep running and ignore the bleeding
Wash the wound with clean water, apply antiseptic, and put a bandage on it
Rub soil on it to stop the bleeding

questions.explanation_correct: Ajay should first wash the wound with clean water to remove dirt. Then apply antiseptic cream to kill germs and prevent infection. Finally, put a clean bandage on it to protect the wound. He should tell a teacher or parent about the injury.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Ignoring bleeding, using glue, or rubbing soil are all wrong. Soil has germs that can cause infection. The correct first aid for a scraped knee is: wash with clean water, apply antiseptic, and cover with a clean bandage.

questions.question_text: What items should a first aid box contain?

options.text: Bandages, antiseptic cream, cotton, and scissors

questions.explanation_correct: A first aid box should contain bandages (to cover wounds), antiseptic cream or liquid (to kill germs), cotton (for cleaning wounds), scissors, and other medical supplies. Every home and school should have a first aid box.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A first aid box is for medical emergencies, not for toys, books, or clothes. It contains medical supplies like bandages, cotton, antiseptic, thermometer, and scissors that help treat minor injuries and illness quickly.

questions.question_text: What should you NOT do if someone is bleeding from a cut?

options.text: Wash the cut with clean water
Press a clean cloth on the cut to stop bleeding
Put dirty soil or mud on the wound

questions.explanation_correct: You should NEVER put dirty soil or mud on a wound. Soil and mud contain harmful germs and bacteria that can cause serious infection. Infections can make the wound much worse and the person very sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Washing with clean water, pressing a clean cloth, and applying antiseptic are all correct first aid steps. Putting soil or mud on a wound is the wrong thing to do because it introduces dirt and germs that can cause dangerous infections.

questions.question_text: A good touch is a touch that makes you feel _____.
questions.explanation_correct: A good touch makes you feel safe, happy, and loved. Examples include a hug from your parents, a pat on the back from a teacher for doing well, or holding hands with friends while playing. Good touches are warm and caring.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Touches that make you scared, confused, upset, or hurt are not good touches. A good touch makes you feel safe, comfortable, and cared for. It comes from people who love and care about you.

questions.question_text: What is a bad touch?

options.text: A pat on the back from your teacher
Any touch that makes you feel uncomfortable, scared, or confused
Holding hands with a friend while playing

questions.explanation_correct: A bad touch is any touch that makes you feel uncomfortable, scared, confused, or upset. If anyone touches you in a way that does not feel right, it is a bad touch, no matter who the person is.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Hugs from parents, pats from teachers, and holding friends' hands are usually good touches. A bad touch is any touch that makes you feel wrong, uncomfortable, or scared. You should always trust your feelings about touch.

questions.question_text: If someone gives you a bad touch, what should you do?

options.text: Say NO loudly, move away, and tell a trusted adult (parent, teacher, or relative)

questions.explanation_correct: If someone gives you a bad touch, you should say NO loudly and clearly, move away from that person, and immediately tell a trusted adult like your parent, teacher, or grandparent. It is never your fault. You should not keep it a secret.
questions.explanation_incorrect: You should never stay quiet, blame yourself, or keep it a secret. Bad touch is NEVER the child's fault. The right thing to do is: say NO firmly, get away from the person, and tell a trusted adult. Keep telling until someone helps you.

questions.question_text: Who is a trusted adult you can talk to if someone makes you feel unsafe?

options.text: Nobody, you should handle it yourself

questions.explanation_correct: Trusted adults include your parents, teachers, grandparents, school counsellor, or any adult you feel safe with. If someone makes you feel uncomfortable or unsafe, tell a trusted adult right away. They will help you.
questions.explanation_incorrect: You should not talk to strangers or try to handle it alone. Children need adult help in such situations. Parents, teachers, grandparents, and school counsellors are trusted adults who will listen, believe you, and help keep you safe.

questions.question_text: Which of these statements about personal safety is TRUE?

options.text: Bad touch is always the child's fault
You should keep bad touch a secret
Your body belongs to you, and you have the right to say NO to any touch that makes you uncomfortable
Only strangers can give bad touch

questions.explanation_correct: Your body belongs to you, and you have the right to say NO to any touch that makes you uncomfortable, no matter who the person is. Bad touch is never the child's fault, it should never be kept a secret, and it can come from anyone, not just strangers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bad touch is NEVER the child's fault. It should NEVER be kept a secret. And bad touch can come from anyone, not only strangers. The truth is that your body belongs to you, and you always have the right to say NO to any touch that feels wrong.

questions.question_text: Red traffic light means GO.
questions.explanation_correct: This statement is false. Red traffic light means STOP, not GO. Green means GO. Everyone must stop when the light is red and wait until it turns green before moving.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Red always means STOP. Green means GO. This is one of the most important traffic rules. If you see a red light, you must stop and wait. Moving on a red signal is dangerous and against the rules.

questions.question_text: You should always use the zebra crossing to cross the road.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. The zebra crossing is the safest place to cross the road. Vehicles are supposed to stop for pedestrians at a zebra crossing. Always look both ways even at a zebra crossing before stepping onto the road.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Using the zebra crossing is the safest way to cross the road. Drivers know they must stop for people at the zebra crossing. Always use it when available, and still look both ways before crossing.

questions.question_text: Children should play with matchsticks and lighters.
questions.explanation_correct: This statement is false. Children should NEVER play with matchsticks or lighters. They can start a fire that can burn them or their surroundings. Fire is very dangerous and children should always stay away from fire-related objects.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Children should never play with matchsticks, lighters, or any fire-related objects. They are not toys. A small flame can quickly become a big fire that is very hard to control and can cause serious burns or even death.

questions.question_text: During a fire, smoke rises up, so we should crawl low on the floor to avoid breathing in smoke.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. During a fire, hot smoke rises upward. The air near the floor is cleaner and cooler. By crawling low, you can breathe cleaner air and find your way to safety more easily.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Smoke does rise upward during a fire, making the air near the floor cleaner. Crawling low helps you avoid breathing in the dangerous smoke and allows you to see the exit more clearly.

questions.question_text: For a small burn, you should put butter or oil on it.
questions.explanation_correct: This statement is false. You should NEVER put butter, oil, or toothpaste on a burn. These can trap heat inside the burn and make it worse. The correct first aid is to hold the burn under cold running water for at least 10 minutes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Putting butter or oil on a burn is a common mistake. These substances trap heat and can make the burn worse. The correct treatment is to run cold water over the burn for at least 10 minutes to cool it down.

questions.question_text: If someone gives you a bad touch, you should keep it a secret.
questions.explanation_correct: This statement is false. You should NEVER keep a bad touch a secret. Always tell a trusted adult like your parent, teacher, or grandparent. They will help protect you. Bad touch is never your fault and you should always speak up.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A bad touch should never be kept secret. The person who gave the bad touch might tell you to keep it a secret, but you should not listen. Always tell a trusted adult. Speaking up is the right and brave thing to do.

questions.question_text: Wearing a helmet while riding a bicycle protects your head from injury.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. A helmet is designed to protect your head if you fall or have an accident while cycling. Head injuries can be very serious and even life-threatening. A helmet cushions the impact and can save your life.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Helmets are specifically designed to protect the head from injuries during falls or accidents. The hard outer shell and soft padding inside absorb the shock. Always wear a helmet while cycling.

questions.question_text: First aid is only given by doctors.
questions.explanation_correct: This statement is false. First aid can be given by anyone who knows basic first aid. It is the immediate help given before a doctor arrives. Even children can give simple first aid like washing a cut or telling an adult about an injury.
questions.explanation_incorrect: First aid is not only for doctors. Anyone can give first aid. The whole point of first aid is to provide quick help before medical professionals arrive. Basic first aid like cleaning wounds and applying bandages can be done by anyone.

questions.question_text: The black and white stripes on the road for crossing are called a _____ crossing.
questions.explanation_correct: The black and white stripes on the road are called a zebra crossing. It is called 'zebra' because the stripes look like the stripes on a zebra. Pedestrians should use the zebra crossing to cross the road safely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is zebra. A zebra crossing has black and white stripes painted on the road, just like the stripes on a zebra animal. It marks the safest place for people to cross the road.

questions.question_text: In case of a fire, you should call the fire brigade at number _____.
questions.explanation_correct: In India, the fire brigade number is 101. In case of a fire, call 101 immediately. Tell them your address and what is happening. Other important numbers are 100 for police and 102 for ambulance.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 101. This is the fire brigade emergency number in India. Remember: 100 = Police, 101 = Fire Brigade, 102 = Ambulance. These are important numbers everyone should know.

questions.question_text: For a small cut, first wash it with clean water, then apply _____ cream, and put a bandage.
questions.explanation_correct: After washing a cut, apply antiseptic cream (like Dettol or Savlon) to kill germs and prevent infection. Antiseptic means something that kills germs. Then cover the wound with a clean bandage to protect it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is antiseptic. Antiseptic cream or liquid helps kill germs on the wound and prevents infection. Common antiseptics in India include Dettol and Savlon. Always apply antiseptic after cleaning a wound.

questions.question_text: If someone gives you a bad touch, you should say _____, move away, and tell a trusted adult.
questions.explanation_correct: If someone gives you a bad touch, say NO loudly and clearly. You have the right to say NO to any touch that makes you uncomfortable. Then move away from that person and tell a trusted adult immediately.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is NO. You must say NO firmly and loudly. Your body belongs to you and no one has the right to touch you in a way that makes you uncomfortable. After saying NO, get away and tell a trusted adult.

questions.question_text: Meera is sitting in the back seat of a car. What should she do for her safety?

options.text: Put her head out of the window
Wear her seatbelt and sit properly
Keep opening and closing the door

questions.explanation_correct: Meera should wear her seatbelt and sit properly. Even in the back seat, wearing a seatbelt is important. Standing, putting body parts out of windows, and playing with doors are all very dangerous and can cause serious injuries.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Standing on seats, hanging out of windows, and playing with car doors are extremely dangerous. The safest thing to do in a car is to wear your seatbelt, sit properly, and keep arms and head inside the car at all times.

questions.question_text: Which of these should you do BEFORE bursting firecrackers during Diwali?

options.text: Burst them near a petrol pump
Burst them in an open area with an adult supervising, and keep water nearby
Hold them in your hand while they burn

questions.explanation_correct: Firecrackers should only be burst in open areas (not inside houses), with an adult supervising, and a bucket of water should be kept nearby for emergencies. Never hold burning crackers in your hand or burst them near fuel.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bursting crackers inside, near petrol pumps, or holding them while burning are all extremely dangerous. The safe way is to burst them in an open area, with adult supervision, away from buildings, and with a bucket of water ready for emergencies.

questions.question_text: Nisha's friend fell off the swing and hurt her arm badly. Nisha should _____.

options.text: Try to fix the arm herself
Ask her friend to keep playing
Immediately call a teacher or adult for help

questions.explanation_correct: Nisha should immediately call a teacher or adult for help. A badly hurt arm could be broken or sprained, and it needs proper medical attention. Children should not try to fix serious injuries themselves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Children should never try to treat serious injuries themselves. Asking someone to keep playing when hurt can make the injury worse. Ignoring it is wrong. The right action is to get adult help immediately for any serious injury.

questions.question_text:
Match the emergency number with the service:
1. 100  2. 101  3. 102
questions.explanation_correct: 100 is for Police, 101 is for Fire Brigade, and 102 is for Ambulance. Every child should remember these emergency numbers. In any emergency, call the appropriate number for help.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct matching is: 100 = Police (for crime or safety emergencies), 101 = Fire Brigade (for fire emergencies), 102 = Ambulance (for medical emergencies). These are important numbers everyone in India should remember.

questions.question_text: Children should never play with _____, lighters, or the gas stove because they can start fires.
questions.explanation_correct: Children should never play with matchsticks, lighters, or the gas stove. All of these can produce fire, which is very dangerous. A small fire can quickly become a big fire that is very hard to control.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is matchsticks. Matchsticks, lighters, and gas stoves all produce fire. They are not toys and should never be played with. Fire can cause serious burns and can destroy an entire house.

questions.question_text: A box containing bandages, antiseptic, and cotton for treating injuries is called a _____ aid box.
questions.explanation_correct: A box containing medical supplies for treating injuries is called a first aid box. Every home, school, and workplace should have a first aid box that is well-stocked and easily accessible during emergencies.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is first. A first aid box (or first aid kit) contains essential supplies like bandages, antiseptic cream, cotton, scissors, and other items needed to give immediate help when someone is injured.

questions.question_text: You should always wear a _____ on your head while riding a bicycle to protect yourself from head injuries.
questions.explanation_correct: You should always wear a helmet while riding a bicycle. A helmet protects your head from serious injury if you fall. Head injuries are very dangerous, and a helmet can save your life.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is helmet. A helmet has a hard outer shell and soft padding inside that absorbs shock during a fall. It is the most important piece of safety equipment for cycling.

questions.question_text: Which of these is the FIRST thing to do when you discover a fire in a building?

options.text: Alert everyone by shouting 'FIRE!' and move towards the exit
Go to the kitchen to get water

questions.explanation_correct: The first thing to do is alert everyone by shouting 'FIRE!' so that all people in the building know about it. Then, move quickly towards the exit. Do not waste time collecting belongings. Your life is more important than any material thing.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Do not waste time collecting toys, opening windows (which can spread fire), or going to the kitchen. The first priority is to alert everyone and get out of the building as fast as possible. Use stairs, not lifts, during a fire.

questions.question_text: Your body belongs to you and you have the right to say NO to any touch that makes you feel uncomfortable.
questions.explanation_correct: This is absolutely true. Your body is yours and nobody has the right to touch you in a way that makes you uncomfortable or scared. You always have the right to say NO. This is true regardless of who the other person is.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is a true and very important fact. Every child has the right to say NO to any touch that does not feel right. Your body belongs to you, and anyone who touches you in a way that makes you uncomfortable is wrong, not you.

questions.question_text: Which of these is the SAFEST behaviour?

options.text: Running across the road without looking
Following traffic rules, wearing a seatbelt, and crossing at the zebra crossing
Riding a bicycle without a helmet at night without lights

questions.explanation_correct: Following traffic rules, wearing a seatbelt, and crossing at the zebra crossing are all safe behaviours that protect you from accidents and injuries. Safety rules exist to keep everyone safe on the road.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Running across roads, playing with firecrackers alone, and cycling without a helmet at night are all extremely dangerous behaviours. The safest option is to follow all traffic rules, wear safety gear, and use zebra crossings.
